Use Habitica to help with ADHD, self care, Nâ¦
data.text:
Habitica is a free habit-building and productivity app that uses retro RPG elements to gamify your tasks and goals.

Use Habitica to help with ADHD, self care, New Yearâs resolutions, household chores, work tasks, creative projects, fitness goals, back-to-school routines, and more!

How it works:

Create an avatar then add tasks, chores, or goals youâd like to work on. When you do something in real life, check it off in the app and receive gold, experience, and items that can be used in-game!

Features:

â¢ Automatically repeating tasks scheduled for your daily, weekly, or monthly routines

â¢ Flexible habit tracker for tasks you want to do multiple times a day or only once in awhile

â¢ Traditional to do list for tasks that only need to be done once

â¢ Color coded tasks and streak counters help you see how youâre doing at a glance

â¢ Leveling system to visualize your overall progress

â¢ Tons of collectable gear and pets to suit your personal style

â¢ Inclusive avatar customizations: wheelchairs, hair styles, skin tones, and more

â¢ Regular content releases and seasonal events to keep things fresh

â¢ Parties let you team up with friends for extra accountability and battle fierce foes by completing tasks

â¢ Challenges offer shared task lists you can add to your personal tasks

â¢ Guilds let you connect with others that share your interests and goals

â¢ Reminders and widgets to help keep you on track

â¢ Customizable color themes with dark and light mode

â¢ Syncing across devices

â

Habitica is an open-source app run by a small team thatâs made better by the work of volunteers who contribute pixel art, translations, bug fixes, and more. If youâd like to contribute, reach out!

Community, privacy, and transparency are important to us. Your tasks are private and we donât sell your personal data to third parties.

Check out our instagram or twitter(@habitica) for the latest news, announcements, and feature spotlights!

â-

Habitica can be fully enjoyed for free, but if you would like to help support us, we offer optional in-app purchases and subscriptions. If you choose to purchase a subscription, payment will be charged to your Apple account only when you confirm your purchase.

There are four types of optional Habitica subscriptions: $4.99 every month; $14.99 every three months; $29.99 every six months; and $47.99 every year, which is a 20% discount! (Prices may vary by location.) Subscriptions renew automatically unless cancelled at least 24 hours prior to the end of the current period. You can manage your subscription and turn off auto-renewal in your Apple Account Settings after purchase. Thanks for choosing Habitica!

Terms of use: https://habitica.com/static/terms

New in 3.11:

â¨- The To Do list widget is here! Keep track of your To Doâs right from your home screen with this highly requested new widget.â¨

- The Quest Shop now shows a check mark next to Quests youâve already completed so it's easier to see which you still need!â¨

- A star will now appear by the Pet or Mount you have equipped

â¨- The list of Challenges in the Discover sectionâ¨ should load more smoothly now

- You can now change class from the Market when viewing equipment from other classes

- Typing in a custom number to the bulk purchase field will no longer cause a crashâ¨

- Various other bug fixes and improvements

SuziQRSM ,

exactly what you need to start setting and tracking your goals!

This app is awesome you guys! Iâm earning points like crazy, and Iâve put a goal for myself â â even though you can actually get gems and articles to go on your little dude â â I chose the reward I want so (you can customize it)and Iâm doing it!! Iâm doing what Iâm supposed to do. Itâs fun to go in and check it off and hear it make noises and give you points! I highly recommend if you donât have a habit of setting goals (your three things a day) that you go in and you start with at least three things you can delete what they have by swiping the left or you can stick with what they have and thereâs habits, daily, and Projects basically three different categories you can set up! There are so many different things you can do to customize this to fit your schedule and your needs you can make one for Budget. You can make one for Goals or Projects. The only thing negative is that itâs a little messy and difficult to navigate; or I wouldâve given it five stars. If they could clean it up a little bit, make the tabs to the different categories either up on top or larger and give a better understanding of points and how they were awarded it would be perfect ( and he's I went through the tutorials). But it's really awesome as is!!

Pandabooks ,

Really Helpful for School!

Itâs ridiculously hard to stay motivated during virtual classes, and I think Habitica has been a big help! I have all my school assignments up on my To-Do list, which is really helpful for keeping track of what to do and for staying motivated in the middle of working on an assignment.

The main reason why I love it so much is that itâs ridiculously effective for me and itâs just what I was looking for. A lot of other habit-tracker/to-do list apps arenât in an engaging format, and I delete them after slowly losing interest over the course of a few days. I didnât have this problem with Habitica, because of how itâs part game and part productivity tracker. Iâve been looking for an app like this for ages, and I didnât find this until my friend recommended it (and thank goodness she did).

I havenât noticed any bugs, other than the occasional small bug that comes from not syncing with the happening on my computer quickly enough. Occasionally thereâs an issue where I check off a To-Do list item or a Daily and it doesnât change color immediately, but itâs no big deal because the color changes if I go to another tab and then go back to the original. Iâm also not entirely sold on the idea of gems basically being only obtainable through money, but I can appreciate that the things they purchase confer mostly cosmetic benefit.

Developer Response ,

Hey Pandabooks. Thanks for your review and kind words, they mean a lot to us! If you'd like to share any further feedback, please feel free to reach out via Menu - About - Send Feedback.

VI Visceral ,

Habitica can be a total Game Changer

Iâve been using Habitica for almost two years now, and Iâm here to say that as I was initially a casual user of the app, and have moved to being a player in a world parallel yet decidedly different from our own. With Habitica being a highly customizable game, you truly can gamify your habits and tasks to suit your own level of creativity, utilitarianism, minimalism, and community engagement. The guilds are supportive and members are eager to give encouragement and feedback, and the challenges that the guilds provide are usually well written and sometimes use âRPG lingoâ to make it more like a game and less like a chore list.

I started changing the names of my tasks to âunlock achievements â and my habit lists to âActivate power ups â , and itâs been significantly helpful to keep my attention and engagement with the app. Furthermore: purchasing the app is going to be the game changer. While you donât technically âneedâ to, it opens up another level of interest and engagement with special Pet and potion Quests, and Habitica gives you a bundle of items every month you subscribe, and a special little pet as a thank you. Purchases keep the app free and free of ads for free users.

However, this month I found that the Mystery Gift items did not show up in my Items list. Iâm wondering if itâs a bug

Developer Response ,

Hey VI Visceral! Thank you so much for this thoughtful review. We're happy to hear Habitica has been helpful for you! If youâd like to share any feedback with us directly, you can do that via Menu - Support - Submit Feedback.
